docstring.long_description:
The description of that function is as follows:

    Compute several descriptive statistics of the passed array.
docstring.short_description: The DESCRIBE node is based on a numpy or scipy function.

parameters.name: select_return
parameters.type: This function has returns multiple objects ['nobs', 'mean', 'variance', 'skewness', 'kurtosis'].
parameters.description:
Select the desired one to return.
See the respective function docs for descriptors.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.description:
Axis along which statistics are calculated. Default is 0.
If None, compute over the whole array 'a'.

parameters.name: ddof
parameters.description: Delta degrees of freedom (only for variance). Default is 1.

parameters.name: bias
parameters.description: If False, then the skewness and kurtosis calculations are corrected for statistical bias.

parameters.name: nan_policy
parameters.description:
Defines how to handle when input contains nan.
The following options are available (default is 'propagate'):
'propagate': returns nan
'raise': throws an error
'omit': performs the calculations ignoring nan values
